properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain associated with a low pressure system over Hudson Bay will continue in Cape Dorset and Kimmirut tonight. Total rainfall amounts of anywhere from 25 to 40 mm are expected by the time the rain tapers off during the day on Thursday. ### Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-19T18:43:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-19T02:44:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1567748943.2019
Area: Kimmirut, Cape Dorset
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain associated with a strong low pressure trough over eastern Hudson Bay will affect Kimmirut and Iqaluit today. As the trough passes by tonight, the rain will taper off. Total rainfall amounts of anywhere from 25 to 30 mm are expected. ### Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-20T06:22:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-19T14:23:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1543372611.2019
Area: Iqaluit, Kimmirut
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winds with gusts up to 100 km/h are occurring over these regions. They will gradually diminish this morning. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-19T18:59:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-19T08:28:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3182544211.2019
Area: Kangiqsujuaq - Raglan Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Tropical Cyclone Information Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: For Hurricane Humberto. The next information statement will be issued by 03:00 p.m. ADT. Humberto will approach Canadian marine waters today. It will begin to affect the Scotian Slope and the southern Grand Banks tonight and Friday. 1. Summary of basic information at 09:00 a.m. ADT. Location: Near 36.0 North 60.9 West. About 885 kilometres south of Sable Island. Maximum sustained winds: 195 kilometres per hour. Present movement: Northeast at 37 kilometres per hour. Minimum central pressure: 952 millibars. 2. Public weather impacts and warnings summary. No significant effects are expected over land. a. Wind. No significant wind expected. b. Rainfall. No significant rain expected. c. Surge/Waves. Swells of 2 to 3 metres will reach the Atlantic coast of Nova Scotia Friday, and 3 to 5 metres swells will likely reach southern Newfoundland on the weekend. 3. Marine weather impacts and warnings summary. Storm warnings are in effect for East Scotian Slope - southeastern half, Laurentian Fan, and Southwestern Grand Banks. Gales warnings are in effect for Georges Bank, West Scotian Slope, Sable - eastern half, East Scotian Slope - northwestern half, and Banquereau - southern half. Gale to Storm Force winds are forecast over the Scotian Slope waters, Laurentian Fan, Banquereau, and the southern Grand Banks Friday into Saturday. As the winds increase, large waves of 7 to 10 metres will build over offshore waters. Some of these waves could exceed 10 metres southeast of the track as the centre passes over Laurentian Fan and the southern Grand Banks. Forecaster(s): Hatt/Couturier. ### Please continue to monitor alerts issued by the Canadian Hurricane Centre and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-09-20T17:49:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-19T11:50:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3943904043.2019
Area: Avalon Peninsula Southeast, Avalon Peninsula Southwest
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Temperatures will drop under the freezing mark locally over these regions tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-19T17:59:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-19T02:57:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0388907347.2019

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Clear skies and light winds will give favourable conditions for the formation of frost tonight, especially in low lying inland areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-09-20T05:19:36-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong westerly winds with gusts up to 100 km/h will develop late this evening in the Canada Bay area. These winds are expected to diminish below warning criteria by early Friday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-09-20T05:15:45-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-19T13:16:45-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3102390086.2019
Area: Northern Peninsula East
properties.Author: Environment Canada
